content.description: A wide start with some rat poo and choss leads you up to beautiful crack features - protects basically everywhere and would clean up great over time. Unfortunately no bolts at the top just yet (extremely unestablished), just gotta downclean your gear on the way out!
content.protection: Honestly a single rack .3-2 would do ya well (including DIY anchor)
content.location: bush wack your way to the hands, scurry around the right side of the rock until you find the largest/most obvious feature that you saw from the road.

content.description: Right variation to Prayer Hands, skips the wide beginning and instead takes you on a beautiful horizontal hand jam journey up to a perfect .4-.5 crack and out to the finish. Once again, no bolts on top - back clean gear on the way out.
content.protection: Gear from .3-1 (maybe an extra #1?) will get you there with gear for the anchor.
content.location: Go to the beginning of Prayer Hands, then walk up and right through a little tree until you see the horizontal hand crack about 6-8ft up.
